newsitem.title: USA: Producer, arranger Foster signs pact with Warner.
newsitem.headline: Producer, arranger Foster signs pact with Warner.

text.p: Fourteen-time Grammy award-winning producer, arranger and composer David Foster has entered an exclusive multi-year pact with Warner Music Group, the company said Thursday.
Under the agreement, Foster becomes senior vice president of Warner Music, producing records for all of Warner Music Group labels and acting as a consultant for senior management of the company.
Warner Music Group, one of the world's leading music companies, is a division of Time Warner Inc. The Warner Music Group is comprised of recording labels Elektra, Atlantic and Warner Bros. Records.

The agreement also expands a relationship between Atlantic Records and Foster's 143 Records label into a joint venture between the two companies. Launched in 1994, the label is responsible for the international hit album "Forgiven, Not Forgotten" by the Irish rock band The Corrs.

Foster, who has been a vice president of Atlantic Records since 1994, has produced several hit songs, including Celine Dion's Grammy-winning "Falling Into You," Natalie Cole's "Unforgettable" and Whitney Houston's "The Bodyguard."

Foster started out in the music business at age 16 was a member of Chuck Berry's band. Relocating from his native Victoria, British Columbia, to Los Angeles, Foster's group Skylark scored a Top 1O hit, "Wildflower," in 1971.
Working throughout the early 1970s as one of the industry's premier session musicians, Foster performed with such superstars as John Lennon, George Harrison and Barbra Streisand.
Industry sources speculated that Foster's expanded role represents an effort by Warner Music to shore up its market share which has slipped in recent years.
